MONARCHY.Definition: a country that has a king or queen

SPLIT.Definition: to (cause to) divide into two or more parts, especially along a particular line

ASSUMING.Definition: to accept something to be TRUE without question or proof

KEEP YOUR EYES PEELED.Definition: to watch carefully for someone or something

THE CHANNEL.Definition: the area of sea that separates England from France

EXECUTED.Definition: to kill someone as a legal punishment

FLIRTATION.Definition: a situation in which someone behaves as if sexually attracted to another person, without being seriously interested

REPUBLICANISM.Definition: belief in or support for government by elected representatives of the people, rather than government by a king or queen

REIGNED.Definition: to be the king or queen of a country

IN LINE TO THE THRONE.Definition: to be the person who will become king or queen after the present ruler

ABDICATED.Definition: If a king or queen abdicates, he or she makes a formal statement that he or she no longer wants to be king or queen

SMALL TALK.Definition: conversation about things that are not important, often between people who do not know each other well

DUTIES.Definition: things that you have to do because it is part of your job, or that you feel is the right thing to do

CEREMONIAL.Definition: related to, used in, or involving a ceremony (= a fixed set of formal acts performed on important social or religious occasions)

COLLECTIVE.Definition: of or shared by every member of a group of people

UNITY.Definition: the state of being joined together or in agreement

CONTINUITY.Definition: the fact of something continuing for a long period of time without being changed or stopped

NEUTRAL.Definition: not saying or doing anything that would encourage or help any of the groups involved in an argument or war

APPOINT.Definition: to choose someone officially for a job or responsibility

SPECULATION.Definition: the activity of guessing possible answers to a question without having enough information to be certain

BROOCH.Definition: a small piece of jewellery with a pin at the back that is fastened to a woman's clothes

SUSPICION.Definition: a belief or idea that something may be TRUE

IN THE PUBLIC EYE.Definition: to be famous and written about in newspapers and magazines and seen on television

BRANDS.Definition: a type of product made by a particular company

DIALOGUE.Definition: conversation that is written for a book, play, or film

GOT RID OF.Definition: to not now have an unwanted or unpleasant task, object, or person

PROPORTION.Definition: the number or amount of a group or part of something when compared to the whole

ABOLISH.Definition: to end an activity or custom officially

VALID.Definition: based on truth or reason; able to be accepted

QUOTED.Definition: to repeat the words or ideas that someone else has said or written

TOLERATE.Definition: to accept behaviour and beliefs that are different from your own, although you might not agree with or approve of them

DISPUTE.Definition: to disagree with something that someone says

CONTRADICTORY.Definition: If two or more facts, pieces of advice, etc. are contradictory, they are very different from each other

MONARCHIC.Definition: relating to or suitable for a king or queen, or relating to a monarchy

MERIT.Definition: the quality of being good and deserving praise

SO BE IT.Definition: used to say that it is necessary to accept the situation as it exists

BLAND.Definition: not having a strong taste or character or not showing any interest or energy

PUTTING A FOOT OUT OF LINE.Definition: doing something that you should not do or to behave in an unacceptable way

TRACK RECORD.Definition: all the achievements or failures that someone or something has had in the past

STICKS ITS NECK OUT.Definition: To personally assume or expose oneself to some risk, danger, or responsibility; to imperil oneself or put oneself in harm's way

TACTIC.Definition: a planned way of doing something

BLEND INTO THE BACKGROUND.Definition: to be invisible against one's surroundings

PATRONS.Definition: a person or group that supports an activity or organisation, especially by giving money

UNELECTED.Definition: not having been voted into a particular important job or position

SCANDAL.Definition: (an action or event that causes) a public feeling of shock and strong moral disapproval

TURF OUT.Definition: to force someone to leave a place or an organisation
